meanings.definition: The quality or state of being uncouth.
meanings.sent1: Her uncouthnesses were evident in the way she slurped her soup.
meanings.sent2: The uncouthnesses of his behavior at the dinner party shocked everyone.
meanings.sent3: Despite his uncouthnesses, he always managed to make people laugh with his jokes.
meanings.sent4: The uncouthnesses of the situation left everyone feeling uncomfortable.
meanings.sent5: The teacher addressed the uncouthnesses in the classroom by teaching proper etiquette.

meanings.sent1: The party guests were taken aback by the uncouthnesses of the host.
meanings.sent2: His uncouthnesses often led to awkward social situations.
meanings.sent3: The uncouthnesses of his table manners made his date cringe.
meanings.sent4: The uncouthnesses of his speech were like nails on a chalkboard.
meanings.sent5: She tried to overlook his uncouthnesses, focusing instead on his kind heart.

meanings.sent1: His uncouthnesses were particularly evident when he spoke to the waiter.
meanings.sent2: The uncouthnesses of his comments made everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent3: Despite his uncouthnesses, he somehow managed to win people over with his charm.
meanings.sent4: The uncouthnesses of his behavior were a stark contrast to his polished appearance.
meanings.sent5: The politician's uncouthnesses cost him the support of many voters.
